snippet: Bangladesh’s war crimes tribunal on Sunday sentenced to death two expatriates, one now living in the United States, for crimes against humanity during the country’s 1971 war of independence from Pakistan.
abstract: War crimes tribunal in Bangladesh sentences expatriates Chowdhury Mueen Uddin and Ashrafuzzaman Khan to death; men are accused of murder of 18 people described as prominent intellectuals during country's 1971 war of independence from Pakistan.

byline.contributor: Julfikar Ali Maik contributed reporting from Dhaka, Bangladesh.

lead_paragraph: Bangladesh’s war crimes tribunal on Sunday sentenced to death two expatriates, one now living in the United States, for crimes against humanity during the country’s 1971 war of independence from Pakistan.

headline.main: Bangladesh Sentences 2 Expatriates to Death for War Crimes
headline.print_headline: Bangladesh Sentences 2 Expatriates to Death for War Crimes

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject
